chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kesley M Dvorak-Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 14CF1142

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations. Report to Racine Vocational Ministry. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Kesley M Dvorak-Phillips in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Kesley M Dvorak-Phillips in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 2, count 4 & count 7 as charged; DRI the balance.
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 2, count 4 & count 7 as charged; DRI the balance. Order a PSI.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Plea hearing on April 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 12-9-2015:  Defendant is allowed contact with K.D.P. and K.M.W.  No contact with D.H.B.**

**AMENDED 1-12-2016 To be released to probation agent Laurie Bauer to transported to Cross Roads. Must reside at Cross Roads, may not live with grandmother or mother. Once completed at Cross Roads must live where agent approves. Comply with the rules at Cross Roads. **
